summary: The implementation successfully delivers all core requirements for a 3D ghost hunting game using Three.js and React Three Fiber. The code includes a complete 3D environment with atmospheric lighting and fog (REQ-1), autonomous floating ghost entities (REQ-2), click-based ghost catching mechanics (REQ-3), backend score persistence (REQ-4), real-time UI score display (REQ-5), comprehensive dark horror theming (REQ-6), and asset loading from the generated directory (REQ-7). All acceptance criteria appear to be addressed through the implementation.

hallucinated_features.description: Top scores leaderboard functionality with getTopScores query method
hallucinated_features.reason: The backend includes a public query function 'getTopScores' that returns a sorted list of principal-score tuples, which is explicitly listed as a non-goal ('Leaderboards or user profiles')

hallucinated_features.description: Score reset functionality via resetScore method
hallucinated_features.reason: The backend implements a resetScore function allowing users to reset their score to zero, which was not requested in any requirement
Full authentication integration with Internet Identity provider, login/logout flows, and identity management was not requested in the BuildRequest
The useGameState hook includes pauseGame and resumeGame functions, but pausing was not mentioned in requirements. REQ-5 only mentions 'playing' and 'game over' status
